newsitem.title: USA: Chinese reserves safety net for HK dlr--US Summers.
newsitem.headline: Chinese reserves safety net for HK dlr--US Summers.

text.p: U.S. Deputy Treasury Secretary Lawrence Summers said on Wednesday that vast Honk Kong and Chinese foreign exchange reserves are seen as a safety net for the Honk Kong dollar.
Summers said Hong Kong's foreign exchange reserves are now about $64 billion, "a sizeble cushion against exchange rate instability or shock to the balance of payments."
"Hong Kong has also taken measures to ensure that it has the resources to preserve economic and monetary stability should market confidence be rocked by some unanticipated development," Summers said.
Summers also said the steep shape of the Honk Kong yield curve suggested investors' long-term weariness.
"The (Honk Kong) yield curve starts to rise significantly after two and a half years and by ten years out the spread over U.S. Treasuries is nearly 80 basis points.
"This is the market's way of speaking to Beijing to predict problems in the short term but there is wariness about the longer term," Summers said.
